OuFNis HW

OuFNis HW is a collection of tools aims at helping developers in their usually time consuming tasks. The following tools are present at the moment:

  • A set of tools aimed for the SMD line in order to recover the tagged production package, check them and get files that are production ready

  • A set of tools to create the production files directly from the Altium outputs

  • A set of calculators, like optocoupler regimes

  • Some planification tools (not released yet)

Modules

class OuFNis_HW.modules.BOM_tools.BOM_tools

Bases: Action

This module allows to parse altium bom files, and compare them in order to find the differences

At the moment, the tool can find if there is new components added, old component deleted, or mismatches in the quantity. But it can’t find if designators have changed.

has_result() → bool

Return True if the tools has some results, False otherwise

Returns

True if the tools has some results, False otherwise

Return type

bool

m_default_name = 'BOM tools'

Name of the action

start()

Execute the action. The tool suppose the presence of a downloaded file “master.xlsx” and “slave.xlsx” in the folder “downloads” of the “OuFNis_HW”. It is the responsability of the page to prepare the files

class OuFNis_HW.modules.FACTORY_tools.FACTORY_tools

Bases: Threaded_action

This module exposes a set of tools that are usefull for the SMD line in the preparation, validation and transformation of the production packages

action()

Execute the module action

add_add_files(file: str) → None

Add a file with its full svn path that can be downloaded

Parameters

file (str) – An http link to the file

add_del_files(file: str) → None

Add a file that will be deleted from the local production package

Parameters

file (str) – A relative link to the production package to delete

m_default_name = 'FACTORY tools'

The name of the module

prod_file_check_health(file: str, name: str) → None

Check the health of a production file (Presence of a BOM, missing PLM, presence of all the needed file) and display a summary in the “prod_health” section of the webpage

Parameters

  • file (str) – The file to check

  • name (str) – The name of the caller module from the webpage

reset_files()

Reset the files for the add / delete project

set_action(action: str) → None

Set the action to perform

Parameters

action (str) –

Can be the following values:

  • prod_files (To download a production file and its sources from the svn server)

  • validate_prod (to unzip production files, and validate their structure)

  • generate (To create pick&place and BOM files that are compatible with Nexim, along with modifications like offset and PLM checks)

  • package (To generate a production file from an Altium Source, and possiblity a previous production package)

  • machines (To generate a rapport on how to change feeders from one project to another)

set_changelog(assy: str, fab: str, prod: str) → None

Set the changelog information used to generate the production file changelog

Parameters

  • assy (str) – A string with the new changelog for the assembly part of the production folder

  • fab (str) – A string with the new changelog for the fabrication part of the production folder

  • prod (str) – A string with the new changelog for production folder

set_coords(x: int, y: int) → None

Set the offset for the pick and place

Parameters

  • x (int) – The x offset, in mm

  • y (int) – The y offset, in mm

set_first_file(file: str) → None

Set the first working file. Up to 3 working files are used by the module action.

:todo name is not explicity and difficult to document

Parameters

file (str) – The link to the first file

set_offset_check(offset: int) → None

Set a threshold for the pick and place offset check above which an alarm will be given to the user

Parameters

offset (int) – A number, in mm

set_project(project: str, board: str, revision: str, variant: str) → None

Set the project information that are used in package creation

Parameters

  • project (str) – The project’s

  • board (str) – The board name

  • revision (str) – The revision name

  • variant (str) – The variant name

class OuFNis_HW.modules.OPTO_calculator.OPTO_calculator

Bases: Action

Calculate the working points of an optocoupler

m_default_name = 'Optocouplers calculator'

Name of the action

set_data(data: dict) → None

Set the data for the optocoupler to analyse.

Parameters

data (dict) –

The data of the optocoupler to analyse:

  • opto: the simulation model name

  • vin_min and vin_max

  • vin_0, vin_1

  • vout

  • out_min

  • r1 and r2

class OuFNis_HW.modules.SETUP_Packager.SETUP_Packager

Bases: Threaded_action

Create the packages for this tools

Parameters

threaded_action (_type_) – _description_

action()

Execute the module action

m_default_name = 'Binaries Package Manager'

The name of the module

set_action(action: str) → None

Set the action to perform

Parameters

action (str) –

Can be the following values:

  • create_package (to create a new package)

  • upload_package (to upload a previously created package to the FTP server)

  • download_package (to download the package from the FTP server)

  • load_package_file (to set the downlaoded package as the currently used package)

set_file(file: str) → None

Set the file to work with

Parameters

file (str) – The file to work with (either to upload or download)
